headline: Baked Macaroni and Cheese
description: This easy mac and cheese is baked in the oven for a quick and easy meal, making this delicious casserole the perfect homemade comfort food dinner.

video.description: Discover a super-simple way to make mac and cheese from scratch.
video.name: Baked Macaroni and Cheese

name: Baked Macaroni and Cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 2-quart baking dish.
Boil macaroni in a large pot of salted water until barely done, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Whisk together milk and egg in a large bowl. Stir in cheese and butter.
Place par-boiled macaroni in the prepared baking dish. Pour milk mixture over macaroni, season with salt and pepper, and stir until combined. Press mixture evenly into the baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until top is browned, 30 to 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made it liked it so much I made it for our potluck

I didn't make this recipe as it is written. The recipe isn't bad, but changes need to be made. After reading other reviews about there being to much liquid, I agreed, so only used 1 1/2 cups of milk. I did add an egg, but after eating the mac and cheese, saw no point in it, so won't be adding next time. The cheese flavor wasn't what my husband and I were looking for, so next time I will use another cheese, maybe shredded mac and cheese. I melted the cheese with the milk, butter and egg. 1 1/2 cups of milk was plenty, there was not too much liquid, it all blended together very well while baking. I covered the casserole dish taking the cover off 15 min before the mac and cheese was done.
This is a modified recipe of my grandmother's mac and cheese. Always a favorite of my family.
Good not kraft Mac and cheese but good
My family loved it
I love this recipe. I add extra sharp cheddar cheese. I mix it up in the bowl then put it in the pan.
My family asks for this at holiday dinners. It's very close to my grandmother's recipe. :-)

While this is most certainly easy to make, I probably won't be making it again. The shortcuts (such as not taking the time to make a cheese sauce) just aren't worth it. It would be easier to just mix everything together in the bowl instead of the dish. After baking, the mixture separated, with the butter settling next to the noodles, and the milk curdled. It wasn't the most appetizing dish to look at, but at least the flavor, while bland, was decent. Some added seasonings would have helped. Baking it COVERED, instead of uncovered, probably would have helped prevent it from drying out too much. This just wasn't cheesy-tasting like other mac and cheese I've made. I even added some extra cheese on top to try and making it cheesier.
This recipe was so quick simple and yet tasted so good!! This is my new favorite recipe for Mac and cheese!!!
It reminds me of what my mother made when I was a child. Excellent!
It was absolutely flavorful. I added extra cheese & it was YUMMMMY
This recipe is great! It was quick and easy to put together and it tasted great. It was nice to have real mac and cheese for a change. So much better than the boxed ones.
It was easy enough to make put extra cheese turned out good for a first try
I added crushed Ritz crackers to the top. The recipe was excellent!

After seeing a LOT of complaints that it turned out dry and not cheesey, I added extra cheese, little extra milk and put a layer of cheese over the top to help hold in some more moisture. I don't like the texture the egg gives it so next time I think I will omit the egg.
Amazing the whole family loved it easy dinner side and enjoyable

I printed this recipe in 2003 when my three children were small. It is so good, I have seriously made it every single week of their lives. My oldest son recently turned 24 and asked me to make this for his birthday dinner because he loves it so much. The only change I made was to melt 1 tbsp of butter into one cup of Italian seasoned bread crumbs and sprinkle them on top during the last five minutes of baking. It is so easy and delicious! I have taken it to several potlucks and everybody always asks for the recipe! I just sent it to my daughter's best friend from elementary through high school, she remembers eating it at my house over the years and now wants to make it for her own little girl. Thank you so much for sharing this recipe so many years ago, Meredith!
Awesome!
Loved it
Was really good but could of used more cheese. Had hot dogs mixed into this and glazed carrots. Will make it again but next time I will add more cheese to the mixture.
Good but I made some adjustments

This was so good both my husband and I went back at least 3 times for more. I followed some of the other reviews by layering the cheese (noodles, seasoning, cheese, repeat). Then topped with the milk, egg, butter mix. Then baked for 35 min and topped with breadcrumbs for last 5.
Everybody loved it its really delicious
This is a easy delicious recipe I totally recommend this for you
It was very good. I added tuna to make it a meal. I froze it and tasted as if I just cooked it.
I wish I read the reviews before making this. Followed the recipe to the letter - the macaroni was very dry and hard. My kid wouldn't even eat it

This recipe is very good. I did make some minor changes adding 1 cup Asiago cheese along with the sharp cheddar and increased the butter to 4 tablespoons. It was delicious and so easy to make. Great leftover as well.

I made this for dinner and we loved it! I used 4 TB of butter and a bit more cheese after reading the other reviews. I also blended the cheese and milk mixture over heat before adding it to the pasta. Delicious and I will be making it again!
My kids loved it. I actually added more cheese, than the recipe asked
Made it for my son in law who loves Mac and cheese. He said it was really good! It was very easy to make.

Finally a recipe for a firm, oven baked mac & cheese. Just like my West Indian granny used to make. I especially like the firmer, custard-like texture, so I used 2 eggs, not 1 and at least doubled the shredded cheese. Also, used the layering technique another reviewer used. I will never use another recipe for mac & cheese again! Thank you!
I added about a cup more to the top of the casserole before I put it in the oven. It made it nice and cheesy!
It was decent. The noodles were slightly dry on the top considering, so I would probably use a 10oz instead of 12oz so it was a little more ooozie.

This turned out VERY tasty! To the egg/milk/ butter mixture I added garlic powder, onion powder, paprika and old bay (key ingredient, but dont add too much - a few shakes will do). I used 4T butter and 3.5 cups of cheese. I also layered noodles and cheese 3 or 4 times, ending with a cheese layer and then poured the mixture over top, per another reviewers suggestion. Salt and pepper on first 2 layers of noodles only. baked covered for 20 mins then uncovered another 20 mins. 

I will note that there were white chunky curdles all throughout the dish when I dug into it. Im guessing that's a result of adding the melted butter into the cold milk/egg mixture (I let the butter sit to cool before adding it). Is it supposed to be this way? Next time I will take another reviewer's advice and warm the egg/milk mixture on the stove then add the melted butter to the already warm mixture to see if that helps. Otherwise, the flavor was 100% restaurant /catering quality. This is the first time I made this recipe, so if someone knows how to avoid the white chunks please let me know! Will definitely make this again, and likely for holidays as well!
My daughter loved it!!!

This was relatively simple which is why I chose to try it. I ended up going about 35 minutes. I also added enough shredded cheese to cover the top. The top still ended up dry, but once stirred was fine. I forgot to add salt, but it still tasted good. I did have sort of a wet bottom. But once stirred wasn't an issue. Maybe I'll try some of the other tips people mentioned. Will definitely make again.
I made it exactly as it said. It was totally easy and tasted awesome. I hate boxed mac n cheese so very happy to find this one.
I boiled the pasta just a little longer because it doesn’t cook fully in the oven. Other than that it was delicious.
I added I/4 cup of cheese and 1/4 cup of milk to make it a little wetter.

Tastes great! 5 stars!
Made it and will make again

Mix it well bake for 30 to 40 min added another velveta cheese sause mix well and served for christmas eve to my family. It was great none was left.
I made this and added bacon to it - it was a big hit and I will be making it again!!
No changes
Added bacon bits
This was a very delicious meal and I suggest it for the whole family. The salt & pepper wasn’t to overpowering and added just a right amount of flavour.
Qjuick easy and delicious will make again .
This is the easiest recipe for baked Mac and cheese. It doesn't require any fancy cheeses who's name you can't even pronounce, just everyday ingredients in the fridge. Thank you!
White instead of black pepper, garlic and onion powder, 3 cheese blend; extra sharp white cheddar, mild brie, and gouda
used 4 cups shredded white cheddar and put a layer of panko bread crumbs on top before baking
It was really good. I think I will try different kinds of cheese next time. It was a hit.
This had to be the worst macaroni and cheese I have ever had. I never write bad reviews, but this time I am . Save your money and don't make this.

I made this as written. My husband like it. I thought it was just ok. I was looking for something that I could put in the oven with my meatloaf so this looked like it would work. Think I have to experiment a little more to get it to 5 stars.
it was great i add more cheese for toppings
Not a very good recipe. I followed it EXACTLY and it came out bland and tasteless. My husband was nice enough to eat it, but I could only take 3-4 bites. Total disappointment
It was a little dry after coming out of the oven so I think next time, we double the liquid ingredients to make it better.
I just added another cup of cheese. This is a very easy and delicious meal.
easy and delicious! Just added a little bit more cheese on top
So easy! I added an extra layer of cheese on top before baking, because that’s our favorite part!
After reading some of the reviews, I added more milk than recipe called for, and some extra cheese. It STILL came out dry and shells on top were hard and crunchy.
I doubled the recipe, as I'm cooking for a large group. I didn't make any other changes.
Great taste and easy! But I think 2 cups of milk is too much, I used only 1 cup and it was perfect that way.

Used GF pasta, 2 1/2 C sharp cheddar, 1/2 c mozzarella and an extra bit of Mexican blend, about another 1/2 c. Lots of black pepper and added cayenne as well. Next time, I’ll try hatch chili’s in the mix. Cooked 45-50 minutes before I got the edge/browning I wanted. Wonderful!
I added chicken and parm and it's a favorite in my house
This is like my mom's recipe 50 years ago. Only thing is her recipe called for 2 eggs and 1 cup of milk. Her tried and true recipe is so awesome, I think I will keep doing it her way.

Very close to the way my mother taught me some 50+ years ago. However, I have just launched myself into the future and bought an Instant Pot (Duo60Plus) which I have only had a couple days. Does anyone have any ideas how this recipe might be converted to the IP.
Add a can of rotel tomatoes
Quick and easy as well as tasty.

Made as written, I definitely ended up with a spotty cheese mix and little bits of scrambled egg in my macaroni. The only thing I did that wasn't written was I stirred it half-way through cooking to make sure the noodles didn't get hard on the top. Tasted okay, but I will not be making this particular recipe again.

My mom made a similar version. She layered the macaroni and the cheese(lots of cheese) and sprinkled a little flour over the cheese. Seasoned with onion powder and added little pats of butter. Two layers each of macaroni and cheese. Pour milk over the top, just barely covering. Cover with foil and cook 20 minutes. Uncover, top with crushed bbq chips (adds sooo much pizazz!), and continue cooking until bubbly and browning.
Always use this recipe using a variety of cheese.
I found the amount of milk written in the recipe was way to much for the amount of macaroni noodles in one box. I would recommend 1 cup of milk :)

The cheese that wasn't on the very top, sunk to the very bottom, and got over-cooked. So it ended up being crunchy on top, crunchy on the bottom, and just buttery pasta in the middle. If it was served to me like this at a restaurant, I defo would have sent it back. Flavor was ok, but texture failed miserably.
Has no taste. Seems like a whole bag of shredded cheese evaporated.
Truly a delicious,easy to prepare side dish! Will absolutely be making it again!
No changes, I will make it again
This turned out terrible! I should of known better as it didn't seem like enough cheese to me. Ended up with wet flavourless buttered noodles.
i love this easy to make love it kids love it filling and easy and quick to make and really yummy
Yes I'll be making it again love it so does the grandchildren

I made it exactly as stated except I did cover it during cooking and stirred it half-way through cooking. Then I read the reviews; so when it turned out horrible I tried tweaking it and I still couldn't save it. Don't waste your time with this recipe.
made this according to recipe. Did not turn out well at all. not even close to enough cheese or butter. good idea but not portioned well. Ajust before making.
I added extra cheese mid-baking & I love it. I WOULD make it again.
I serve this a lot at my table. Always a treat and a big hit. It’s the closest I can come to my mothers baked macaroni (she never used a recipe)

Very easy to make and was a super hit!

Yes I will make this again. Very good, easy and fast to make.

A great recipe and one that you can add your own twist to. I had heavy cream I needed to use. I used 1 cup and 2 % milk . Sprinkle some Parmesan,Romano and Asiago blend in. I read one review that the macaroni got crusty and hard on top. I stirred it while cooking to avoid it drying out. Add bread crumbs on top if desired.

I just finished making this and it was not what i expected. Im teaching myself how to cook using simplex recipes but this one was a bad one. The noodles at the top crusted over and i had to add a lot more cheese to it. I seasoned it correctly for what its worth... its helped my cooking abilities because at least i know now how to fix/save my dishes. I recommend covering when you put it in the oven and add maybe another cup or two of cheese, i used a whole brick.
I used Asiago and Parmesan Cheese with Whole Wheat Pasta
Made this recipe as written. Took to church Homecoming all comments were how good the Mac and cheese was.

Comes out great! It was a hit with my party guests both times I've made it. I like making it with shell pasta. I did make a few modifications to make it not quite as dry, more cheesy, and flavorful. I use milk and half and half and use more of it than the recipe calls for to keep it form being dry and make it more creamy. I also add an egg or two. I use Velveeta original cheese and 1 extra bag of it than the recipe calls for. I add a little sugar and Tony Chachere's spice for a Creole flair. Enjoy!!
liked it a lot
I find that baked mac and cheese is too dry for my taste. Mine is always stovetop

This tastes very much like the regular dinner mac and cheese my mother made as I was growing up. (Not to be confused with the Sunday Church Supper Mac & Cheese, which begins with a roux for the cheese sauce) I like that this one is a drier dish. I added 4 Tbsp butter and extra cheese, mainly because the family loves butter and cheese. This recipe is most definitely a keeper!

I made some changes as another reviewer suggested. Added 4 Tbl butter, 3 cups cheese (I had a block of American, also added some Colby and cheddar). I also added a pinch of nutmeg which I add whenever I bake mac and cheese or make homemade mashed potatoes. I learned this when I trained in a restaurant years ago. It adds just the extra touch. I also covered with foil and removed the last ten minutes. It was delicious!
